headline.main: LAW INTELLIGENCE; COMMON PLEAS--SPECIAL TERM. Application of Discharge the British Officers from Arrest. THE SLAVE-TRADE. Why her British Captors Thought her a Slaver-Correspondence Concerning Her, CURIOUS CASE OF THE PANCHTA

docs.lead_paragraph: JOHN P. WEEKS VS. OHAS. D. J. ODEVAINE AND OTHERS. It will be recollected that one of the defendants (CHAELES D. J. ODEVAINE) in this case is the British Officer who was put in command of the Panchita by the Captain of the British sloop-of-war Sappho, and by whose directions the Panchita was searched, on the coast of Africa, and then sent to the port of NewYork, at which place the owners caused the defend.

headline.main: Board of Health.; DEPTH OF WATER IN NEW ANCHORAGE.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the Board of Health on Saturday, the following communications were received: To the Honorable, the Commissioners of Health, of the City of New York: The undersigned would respectfully represent to your Honorable Board that he is master of the Bark Oakland, which arrived at Quarantine from Havana on the 20th inst., laden with sugar and tobacco, and having lost one man on the passage, and having sent another to the Marine Hospital.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE ILLINOIS.; THE TRANSIT SQUABBLES. INTERESTING FROM CENTRAL AMERICA. Virtual Settlement of our Difficulties with New-Granada. Later from the South Pacific and British West Indies. ATTEMPTED REVOLUTION IN SAN SALVADOR, $1,458,043 in Treasuree Indian Preparations for Another outbreak. TWO WEEEKS LATER FROM CALIFORNIAA Oregon Knocking at the Door of the Union, Defeat of the Broderick Wing of the Democracy,

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Mail steamship Illinois, C. S. BOGGS, U.S.N., commanding, left Aspinwall, July 19, at 6 P.M., and arrived a Quarantine at 11/2 P.M. on the 27th, making the passage in 7 days and 191/2 hours. The Illinois brings the California mails of July 4, $1,458,043 in treasure on freight, and 459 passengers. Pacific Mail Steamship company's steamer Sonora,

headline.main: The Habeus Corpus and Insane Asylum Patients,

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: Several of Saturdays morning papers contained a report of certain proceedings in the hearing of a habeas corpus, had before Recorder SMITH, which are in several respects erroneous, and in which material facts have been suppressed, to my disadvantage and injury. And as you have not published any report in your paper of the matter, I desire to communicate through you to the public some facts,

docs.lead_paragraph: CoMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--This Board met yesterday at 12 M. in the City Library room-present President PHILLIPS in the Chair, Commissioners MILLER, THOMPSON and ROCKWELL; WALTER F. CONOKLIN, Secretary. The ;pettion of brig Fredonia, from Trinidad de Cuba, for permission to come to City, was referred to the Health Officer with power.

docs.lead_paragraph: JAMAICA vs. BROOKLYN. --The rumor, which seems to be pretty well founded, that the Grand Jury of Kings County, acting upon the suggestion of the Common Council, have presented as a nuisance the running of steam loccomotives upon Atlantic street, has added new flames to the fire of excitement all along the line of the Long Island Railroad.

headline.main: Burial of Eugene Anderson the Murdered Policeman.; Ceremonies at the House and at the Grave, Twenty Thousand Persons In Broadway-Flve Thousand in the Procesnion.

docs.lead_paragraph: EUGENE ANDERSON, the Metropolitan Policeman who was murdered on Tuesday morning last, while in the discharge of his duty, by the burglar CANGEMI, was buried in Greenwood Cemetery yesterday evening. The attendance was very large and the City interest very great indeed.

headline.main: FROM UTAH.; Very Late News--Charges Against Surveyor--General Burr--What the Mormons Say of the Administration Movements--Puguacity. Mormon Sentiments. Deseret News.

docs.lead_paragraph: The St. Louis Republican has intelligence from Great Salt Lake City, brought to St. Louis in 15 days by Mr. MUEDOCK, conductor of the mail. Dates are to July 2. General prosperity and uninterrupted posse prevailed. Some rumors of the military preparations making for the expedition against Utah were current, but did not excite much, if any, alarm.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; City Mortality. Italians in New-York. Quarantine.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is the WEEK BY REPORT OF DEATJ'S in the City and Conty of New.York, from the 18th day of July, to the 25th day of July, 1857: Men, 67; women, 59 ; boys, 191; girls, 154; total, 741.* Adults, 126; children, 845; males, 258; females, 213; colored persons, 9.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have advices from Utah to the 2d of July. The Mormons had received tidings of the military preparattions of the Government, but the news had excited little alarm. The tone of YOUNG'S organ is confident and boastful. Federal ofice-holders are affectionately informed that Utah is not a desinrable abiding place for them, and that " they:will ??ot find it congenial to their health."
